value: Okabe, Mount Utsu, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: A torrent of water rushes down the pass between overhanging hills, towards right with trunks of pine trees.  On the path bordering the stream are peasants bearing bundles of wood.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print in colored ink on paper
Fujiyeda Post Station, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Here Hiroshige shows a lively depiction of porters full of zest and character as they transfer cases from horseback to their brute strength. The official in the far back is making notes, and a few porters are wiping sweat off their backs and brows with their white towels.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Shimada, Travelers Crossing the Oigawa, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Here is a scene of travelers making their way from the east bank of the Oi River to the west bank. During heavy rains, travelers would have to wait until the river subsided. The hotels on either side would become very crowded. Once the water went down they could cross the river themselves or hire watermen to carry them or porters to float them across on a raft.
Kanaya, Travelers Crossing the Oigawa, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Travelers crossing the farther portion of the ford on the river. Lower left, daimyo's litter is supported by a large group of coolies. A light bridge is thrown over the last arm of river. Mountains in distance.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print in colored ink on paper
Nissaka, The Murder-Stone, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Mountain path crosses the lower half of page and ascends steeply between pines to upper right. On it are travelers, some gazing at large boulder. Left, in the gap are peaks of mountains.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Kakegawa, Mount Akiha, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Right, Mount Akiha rises beyond rice fields and mist. Lower half, trestle bridge on which travelers are saluting priest who crosses from left. Kite is flown from left and another has broken loose.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Fukuroi Teahouse, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Left, wayside teahouse with travelers and maid boiling large kettle over fire. Behind is large tree. Right, signpost on which is a bird. Right, roofs of village. Center, rice fields.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Mitsuke, Tenryu-gawa River, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi

label: Description
value: Right, on near arm of river two ferry boats are beached, one with two boatmen. Left, on far side of sandbank are more ferry boats with travelers. Beyond, hills with trees appear in mist.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Ferry at Rokugo, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Kawasaki, Rokugo Watashi-bune Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Five passengers and the man rowing the boat are sailing across the Tama River. The shoreline of Kawasaki shows other merchants and the sort waiting to board the boat. On the left side is a lone man wearing red, standing on a large pile of bamboo. Behind the figures are the tops of buildings and houses. Far into the background is Mt. Fuji on the right side, surrounded by streaks of red clouds it’s the base.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print in colored ink on paper
Hamamatsu, Wintertime, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Here is the subdued scene of farmers warming themselves by a fire under a giant cryptomeria tree overlooks the famous battlefield of Mikatagahara and castle of the first Tokugawa shogun, Ieyasu.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Maisaka, Imaki Point, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Right to center, Imaki Point, a group of rugged peaks, juts out. Right, white peak of Fuji. Around rocky shore are small fishing boats. Lower right, sails of three boats. Lower left, stakes.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Arai Ferryboat, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: A ferryboat with peasants crossing from left. Center, daimyo's boat, screened, with badges and crest. Right, village beyond the water amid pines and mountain peaks in distance.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock, brush and watercolor on paper
Shirasuka Pass, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: The sea with dotted with sails seen in the dip between two hillsides, each with pine trees, just below which appear the heads of daimyo procession. Lower half, the beach, with fishing nets drying. Boats offshore.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Futagawa Teahouse, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Left, teahouse with sign at which one traveler has just arrived. Center, three musicians pass towards teahouse. Beyond is slope with pine trees and flat fields dotted with pines.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Yoshida (Toyokawa Bridge), in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Right, Toyokawa Castle with scaffolding and painters at work. Left, trestle-bridge crosses river to village. Beyond, mountain peaks.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Goyu, Women Detaining Travelers, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Village street at twilight. Center, maid servants are struggling for possession of travelers. Right, in an open teahouse, traveler prepares to wash his feet. On its walls are names of the engraver, printer, designer, and publisher.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Akasaka, Interior of Inn, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Interior of inn. Left, guest reclines and maid brings in his meal on two stands. Other servants are waiting. Right, two geisha arrange their toilet. Center of courtyard, large sago-palm and stone lantern.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Fujikawa, Approach of a Nobleman, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Villagers bowing down as head of daimyo procession reaches the entrance of village. On either side of road, walled bank with trees and bamboos. Lower center, rice fields.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Okazaki, Tenshin Bridge, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Daimyo procession crossing trestle-bridge over river from left to right. Upper half, village, castle, group of low hills and mountain.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color

label: Provenance
value: Mary Rutherford Jay; 1948: acquired by Museum
Hilltop View, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Kanagawa, Dai-no-kei Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Village street rises steeply to right with group of travelers, two of whom are accosted by women, trying to drag them into teahouses. Left, in the bay, boat at anchor, skiff with two men; also five small boats and five boats sailing; cloud in sky.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print in colored ink on paper
Chiryu, The Horse Fair, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Groups of horses tethered in tall grass. Upper center, tree with crowd of horse dealers at its foot and some buildings. Apple-green grass.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Narumi, A Place Famous for Its Cloth, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: One side of village street with two shops for selling stencilled fabrics. Over the nearest is cipher of Hiroshige. Lower left, along the road, woman in a litter with two women attendants. Another, in rear, on horseback.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Miya (Atsuta Jiuji Temple Fete), in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Two teams of men, each with horse, hauling festival cars (not visible), from right to left. Right, part of Torii is seen. Left, building outside of which are two fires, and people watching activities.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Kuwana, Mouth of the Kiso River, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Right, two sailing boats with sails partly lowered, entering inlet on farther side of which is Kuwana Castle. Left, other sailing boats out at sea.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Yokkaichi, River Scene, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: High wind blowing from right across marsh. Right, peasant, cloaked in yellow, on trestle-bridge; another runs to left to catch his hat which has blown off. Center, willow tree. Left, roofs of cottages and boats' masts.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Ishiyakushi Temple, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Left, village temple among trees at base of hill. Beyond are summits of another range of hills. Porters pass along road towards left. Right, two men working in rice fields.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Shono, Rainstorm, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Three villagers with a litter in driving wind and rain on a steep hillside to the left with two others on the right.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Kameyama, Snow Scene, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Snow scene. Right, steep hillsides, snow-laden trees and a procession climbing up to castle. Lower, village. Left, rose-colored glow.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Seki, Early Departure, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Courtyard of inn at which a daimyo is resting, screened with hangings bearing his crest. Lower left, servants preparing to start, adjusting their hats. Others receiving a samurai. The cipher of Hiroshige on lantern of one of latter servants.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Saka-no-shita, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: A teahouse on the edge of a cliff with guests gazing across the valley at a group of peaks and waterfalls.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
Hodogaya (Shinkame Bridge), in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)

label: Description
value: Scene of busy merchants quickly crossing the Shimmachi bridge into town. Two women are sitting enjoying a cup of tea at the base of the bridge.  A row of colorful rooftops continues into the distance and under the hilltop of a large mountain.

label: Physical description
value: Woodblock print in colored ink on paper
